meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.longTitle: An Ordinance to provide for the use of electronic technology in relation to proceedings in a court (which includes specified tribunals) and other court-related purposes; to enable the phased implementation of the use of electronic technology in relation to court proceedings; to enable fees to be provided for in respect of the use of electronic technology in court-related matters; and to provide for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Court Proceedings (Electronic Technology) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: court (法院) means—(a)the Court of Final Appeal;(b)the Court of Appeal;(c)the Court of First Instance;(d)the District Court;(e)a Magistrates’ Court;(f)the Coroner’s Court; or(g)a tribunal specified by rules made under section 6(b);
court office (法院辦事處), in relation to a court, means a registry of the court or an office of the court;
document (文件) means anything in which information of any description is recorded;
e-Court (電子法院) means a court specified by rules made under section 6(a);
electronic form (電子形式) means in the form of an electronic record;

electronic record (電子紀錄) means a record that—(a)is generated in a digital form by an information system;(b)can be transmitted—(i)within an information system; or(ii)from one information system to another; and(c)can be stored in an information system or other medium;
e-proceeding (電子程序)—see section 11(2);
e-system (電子系統) means the information system designated under section 7;
implementation notice (實施公告) means a notice published under section 32(1);
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

section.name: s3
section.heading: References to judge or judicial officer
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to a judge or a judicial officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to a judicial officer as defined by section 2 of the Judicial Officers Recommendation Commission Ordinance (Cap. 92); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes a person appointed as a deputy or temporary judicial officer to perform the duties of, or to act otherwise in the office of, a judicial office as defined by that section.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application to Government
section.content: This Ordinance applies to the Government.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Section 9 of Electronic Transactions Ordinance not affected
section.content: Nothing in this Ordinance affects the application of section 9 of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553) in relation to a legal proceeding.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Chief Justice may by rules specify e-Courts
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to specify the courts by or in relation to which electronic technology may be used under Part 5;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to specify the tribunals for the purposes of paragraph (g) of the definition of court in section 2; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to provide for incidental or supplemental matters (including transitional matters) relating to a specification under paragraph (a) or (b).

part.name: P4
part.heading: Information System to Facilitate Use of Electronic Technology

section.name: s7
section.heading: Chief Justice may designate e-system
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may designate an information system to facilitate the use of electronic technology—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for other court-related purposes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a) or (b), for the particular purposes set out in section 8.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Particular purposes for which e-system may be used

subsection.leadIn: An e-system may be used by a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to create, issue, send or receive documents in electronic form in relation to a proceeding;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to compile, record, store or otherwise process information or documents in electronic form relating to a proceeding; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to allow access to information or documents relating to a proceeding.

subsection.leadIn: An e-system may be used by a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to send documents in electronic form to a court in relation to a proceeding; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to otherwise communicate in electronic form with a court before which a proceeding is being taken.

subsection.content: An e-system may be used to make electronic payments.
An e-system may be used for any other purpose specified by rules made under section 26(2)(c).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) includes—(a)a judge and a judicial officer; and(b)a court office;
send (送交), in relation to a document, means file, lodge, give, notify, serve, deliver, submit, furnish or any other expression that signifies or suggests conveying the document.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Use of Electronic Technology in Courts

section.name: s9
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.def: at the relevant time (在有關時間), in relation to an act done in electronic form or electronically for the purposes of this Part, means at the time of doing the act;
direction of a court (法院指示) means a direction given by a court, a judge or a judicial officer;

e-practice direction (電子實務指示) means a direction that—(a)is issued by the Chief Justice as to the practice and procedure of a court; and(b)relates to the use of electronic technology under this Ordinance;
e-rules (電子規則) means rules made under section 26 or 27;
written law (成文法律) means an Ordinance or subsidiary legislation and includes any practice direction, except an e-practice direction, that provides for the practice and procedure of a court.

section.name: s10
section.heading: References to courts or e-Courts in relation to documents
section.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document created, issued or sent by a court or an e-Court includes a document created, issued or sent by a judge or a judicial officer or a court office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document sent to a court or an e-Court includes a document sent to a judge or a judicial officer or a court office; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a document, file or record kept or maintained by a court or an e-Court includes a document, file or record kept or maintained by a court office.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application of Part 5

subsection.content: This Part applies only in relation to an e-proceeding.

subsection.leadIn: A proceeding is an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: an implementation notice is published stating that the use of electronic technology has been implemented for all proceedings in an e-Court; and
the proceeding is in that e-Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: an implementation notice is published stating that the use of electronic technology has been implemented for a type or description of proceeding in an e-Court; and
the proceeding is in that e-Court and is of that type or description; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: an implementation notice is published stating that the use of electronic technology has been implemented for a type or description of proceeding in an e-Court at a venue; and
the proceeding is in that e-Court at the venue and is of that type or description.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Application of provisions and directions for sending or serving documents in writing

subsection.leadIn: A provision in this Part that applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that requires or permits a document sent by a court to be in writing applies whether the provision of written law or direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uses “send”, “give”, “notify”, “serve”, “deliver” (including grammatical variations and cognate expressions) or any other expression that signifies conveying a document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise suggests the conveying of a document by a court.

subsection.leadIn: A provision in this Part that applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that requires or permits a document sent to a court to be in writing applies whether the provision of written law or direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uses “file”, “lodge”, “send”, “give”, “notify”, “serve”, “deliver”, “submit”, “furnish” (including grammatical variations and cognate expressions) or any other expression that signifies conveying a document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise suggests the conveying of a document to a court.

subsection.leadIn: A provision in this Part that applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that requires or permits a document served by a person on another person to be in writing applies whether the provision of written law or direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uses “serve”, “send”, “give”, “deliver”, “furnish” (including grammatical variations and cognate expressions) or any other expression that signifies service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise suggests the service of a document by a person on another person.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Documents Created, Issued or Sent by Means of e-system

section.name: s13
section.heading: Documents created, issued or sent by courts

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a document created, issued or sent by a court to be in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits a document created, issued or sent by a court to be in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if—

subparagraph.content: the document is created, issued or sent by an e-Court in electronic form by means of an e-system; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the document in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—the document may be created, issued or sent by an e-Court in electronic form if—

subparagraph.content: it is created, issued or sent by means of an e-system; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the document in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Documents sent to courts

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a document sent to a court to be in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits a document sent to a court to be in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if—

subparagraph.content: the document is sent to an e-Court in electronic form by means of an e-system in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the document in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—the document may be sent to an e-Court in electronic form if—

subparagraph.content: it is sent by means of an e-system in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the document in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Endorsements, attachments, etc. in electronic form

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires information to be endorsed or recorded on, or attached or annexed to, a document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits information to be endorsed or recorded on, or attached or annexed to, a document.

subsection.leadIn: If the document is used in an e-proceeding and is in electronic form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if—

subparagraph.content: the information is incorporated in electronic form into the document or associated electronically with it in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information so incorporated or associated would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—the information may be incorporated in electronic form into the document or associated electronically with it if—

subparagraph.content: it is so incorporated or associated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information so incorporated or associated would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information (資料), in relation to a document, includes a note, certificate, statement, acknowledgment, record, matter and another document.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Service between parties

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a document served by a person on another person to be in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits a document served by a person on another person to be in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if—

subparagraph.content: the document is served in electronic form in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the document in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—the document may be served in electronic form if—

subparagraph.content: it is served in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the document in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, this section does not apply in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that requires or permits a document served by or on a court to be in writing.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Authentication of Documents Originating from Courts

section.name: s17
section.heading: Authentication of documents created, issued or sent by courts

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a document created, issued or sent by a court that a provision of written law or a direction of a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires to be signed, sealed or certified; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits to be signed, sealed or certified.

subsection.leadIn: If the document is created, issued or sent by an e-Court in electronic form by means of an e-system in relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if the document is authenticated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)—the document may be authenticated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Authentication of Documents Sent to Courts

section.name: s18
section.heading: Authentication of documents sent to courts

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a document sent to a court that a provision of written law or a direction of a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires to be signed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits to be signed.

subsection.leadIn: If the document is sent to an e-Court in electronic form by means of an e-system in relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if the document is authenticated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)—the document may be authenticated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Authentication of Documents Served by or on Parties

section.name: s19
section.heading: Authentication of documents served by or on parties

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a document served by a person on another person that a provision of written law or a direction of a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires to be signed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits to be signed.

subsection.leadIn: If the document is served in electronic form in relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if the document is authenticated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)—the document may be authenticated in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Electronic Copies of Original Documents etc. and Electronic Production of Documents

section.name: s20
section.heading: Electronic copies of original or certified documents

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires an original or a certified document to be sent to a court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits an original or a certified document to be sent to a court.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if—

subparagraph.content: a copy of the document is sent to an e-Court in electronic form by means of an e-system in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the copy in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—a copy of the document may be sent to an e-Court in electronic form if—

subparagraph.content: it is sent by means of an e-system in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the copy in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Electronic production of documents

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a document to be conveyed by producing it as a paper document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits a document to be conveyed by producing it as a paper document.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-proceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if—

subparagraph.content: a copy of the document is sent to an e-Court in electronic form by means of an e-system in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the copy in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for subsection (1)(b)—a copy of the document may be sent to an e-Court in electronic form if—

subparagraph.content: it is sent by means of an e-system in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions; and
at the relevant time it was reasonable to expect that the information in the copy in electronic form would be accessible so as to be usable for subsequent reference.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Use of printouts of documents issued or sent by courts in electronic form

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of written law or a direction of a court requires or permits a document issued or sent by a court to be in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an e-Court, in reliance on this Part, issues or sends the document in electronic form by means of an e-system (electronic version).

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-proceeding, a printout produced from the electronic version in accordance with any applicable e-rules and e-practice directions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be used for any purpose for which the document or a copy of it is required or permitted to be used under a provision of written law or a direction of a court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the same legal effect as the original of the document or a copy of it (as the case requires).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: printout (打印本) includes a copy of a printout.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Records etc. of Courts in Electronic Form

section.name: s23
section.heading: Keeping or maintaining records etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a provision of written law or a direction of a court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: requires—

subparagraph.content: a document, file or record kept or maintained by a court to be in writing; or
a record made by a court to be in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: permits—

subparagraph.content: a document, file or record kept or maintained by a court to be in writing; or
a record made by a court to be in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an e-Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a)—the requirement is met if the document, file or record is kept or maintained, or the record is made, in electronic form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)—the document, file or record may be kept or maintained, or the record may be made, in electronic form.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Court may disallow use of e-system for sending documents

subsection.leadIn: In an e-proceeding, the court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give a direction disallowing the use of an e-system by a person for sending any document to the court (except for documents already sent), in relation to—

subparagraph.content: the whole proceeding; or
a particular procedure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give any other direction that the court considers necessary because of a direction under paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: In exercising a power under subsection (1), the court may have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the proceeding or procedure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conduct of a party; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other factor that the court considers relevant.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Effect of things done electronically

subsection.content: If, in reliance on Part 5, an act is done in electronic form or electronically, when it would otherwise be required or permitted to have been done using or with respect to a paper document, the doing of that act in electronic form or electronically has the same effect as if that act had been done using or with respect to a paper document.

If, in reliance on Part 5, something takes an electronic form, when it would otherwise be required or permitted to be in the form of a paper document, that thing has the same effect as if it were a paper document.
A document that is authenticated in accordance with section 17 has the same effect as a document duly signed, sealed or certified.
A document that is authenticated in accordance with section 18 or 19 has the same effect as a document duly signed.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Rules, Implementation Notices and Administrative Instructions, for Use of Electronic Technology

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Rules for Practice and Procedure for Use of Electronic Technology

section.name: s26
section.heading: Rules for use of electronic technology

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to regulate or prescribe the practice and procedure to be followed in the use of electronic technology under Part 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), for the particular matters set out in this section.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may, in relation to an e-system—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorize its use by or in relation to an e-Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: authorize its use for a type or description of proceeding that—

subparagraph.content: is within the jurisdiction of an e-Court; and
is specified in the rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify purposes other than those set out in section 8 for which it may be used;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: specify the class or description of persons who may use it; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: provide for registration as a user or any other arrangement to use it for certain purposes relating to a proceeding.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a type or description of proceeding, or matters of a confidential nature, in relation to which electronic technology may not be used for a purpose under Part 5;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify a type or description of document that is required to be in the form of a paper document, whether or not it is used in electronic form in a proceeding;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the conversion of documents in electronic form into paper documents or paper documents into electronic form for any purpose relating to a proceeding;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for anything that by this Ordinance is required to or may be done in accordance with the rules;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: provide for any matter relating to the carrying out of an act by an e-Court under Part 5;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide for any matter relating to electronic payments;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: provide for transitional matters relating to an authorization under subsection (2)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: contain incidental or supplemental provisions for the better carrying out of the provisions of this Ordinance.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Additional rules for use of electronic technology

subsection.leadIn: A power to make rules of court under an Ordinance to provide for the practice and procedure of a court includes, in relation to an e-Court, a power to make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide for the use of electronic technology in proceedings governed by those rules (Ordinance-specific rules); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), to provide for anything that may be done in accordance with rules made under section 26.

subsection.content: Rules made under subsection (1) may supplement or depart from rules made under section 26 to suit the nature or type of proceedings governed by the Ordinance-specific rules.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Rules to Provide for Fees for Use of Electronic Mode

section.name: s28
section.heading: Interpretation of Subdivision 2
section.def: court-related matter (法院相關事宜) means—(a)an act or matter that relates to a proceeding in a court; or(b)a service, or other matter, made available or provided by a court or court office;
e-fee (電子費用) means a fee that is payable under the e-fee rules in respect of a court-related matter that is carried out by an electronic mode;
e-fee rules (電子費用規則) means rules made under section 29;
electronic mode (電子模式) means—(a)an e-system; or(b)another electronic means;
external enactment (外在成文法則) means an enactment other than this Ordinance;
external fee (外在費用) means a fee that is payable under an external enactment in respect of a court-related matter;
external fee item (外在費用項目), in relation to an external fee, means the description of the court-related matter in respect of which the external fee is payable.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Power to provide for fees for use of electronic mode in court-related matters

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules to provide for fees payable in respect of court-related matters that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are carried out by an electronic mode; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are specified in the rules.

subsection.content: Rules made under subsection (1) may provide for fee concessions in respect of particular court-related matters.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under subsection (1) may, in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a court-related matter for which an external fee is payable—provide for an e-fee—

subparagraph.content: by reference to the external fee or the relevant external fee item; or
by reference to the external fee and by adapting the relevant external fee item to suit an electronic mode;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a court-related matter for which no external fee is payable—specify an e-fee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a court-related matter—provide that the fee payable is zero.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section that provide for fee concessions may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide that the fee concessions apply only during a period specified in the rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify different periods for different court-related matters.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section may provide for transitional matters relating to the application of e-fees to court-related matters.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Restrictions on application of e-fees to court-related matters
section.leadIn: The e-fee rules may restrict the application of the e-fees (generally or specifically) to a court-related matter by reference to one or more of the following conditions or matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of an e-system for carrying out the court-related matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the availability of facilities at, or the capacity of, the relevant court or court office to carry out the court-related matter by an electronic mode;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other factor specified in the e-fee rules that may affect the carrying out of the court-related matter by an electronic mode.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Effect of payment of e-fees and of power to provide for e-fees

subsection.content: If an e-fee is provided for in respect of a court-related matter by reference to an external fee or an external fee item (adapted or otherwise), the payment of the e-fee for the court-related matter has the same effect as the payment of the external fee for that court-related matter.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, nothing in this Subdivision affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any power or authority in or under an external enactment to provide for fees payable in respect of a court-related matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the application of an external fee to a court-related matter—

subparagraph.content: that is not specified under section 29 (whether or not carried out by an electronic mode); or
to which the application of an e-fee is restricted under section 30.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Implementation notices

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Justice may provide for the phased implementation of the use of electronic technology in e-Courts and court offices—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Justice may, in an implementation notice, specify the date with effect from which electronic technology may be used for a purpose under Part 5 in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular e-Court (whether or not at a particular venue); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a type or description of proceeding in an e-Court (whether or not at a particular venue) for which the use of an e-system has been authorized by rules made under section 26(2)(b).

subsection.content: The Chief Justice may specify different dates under subsection (2)(b) for proceedings of different types or descriptions or for different venues.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Justice has, in an implementation notice, specified a date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a type or description of proceeding and the venue for it, with effect from that date, the use of electronic technology is implemented for—

subparagraph.content: that type or description of proceeding;
the venue for the proceeding; and
subject to subsection (5), the relevant court office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a type or description of proceeding (without a reference to a venue), with effect from that date, the use of electronic technology is implemented for—

subparagraph.content: that type or description of proceeding; and
subject to subsection (5), the relevant court office.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (4)(a) or (b), the Chief Justice may, in an implementation notice, specify a date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with effect from which the use of electronic technology is implemented for a court office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is different from the date specified for the e-Court concerned.

subsection.content: An implementation notice is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Administrative instructions by Judiciary Administrator

subsection.content: The Judiciary Administrator may issue instructions of an administrative nature relating to the use of an e-system.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), administrative instructions may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for certain purposes relating to a proceeding, matters relating to registration as a user or any other arrangement referred to in section 26(2)(e), including—

subparagraph.content: persons who are eligible to register;
how to register; and
administrative and organizational details relating to the arrangements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: technical matters relating to the use of an e-system, including—

subparagraph.content: the computer hardware, software and other technical requirements for using an e-system;
the format and way in which documents are to be sent to the court under section 14; and
other technical requirements to which those documents must conform; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: matters relating to electronic payments.

subsection.leadIn: The Judiciary Administrator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must publish any administrative instructions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may decide how and where to publish them.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 9
section.def: existing system (現行系統) means any electronic means other than an e-system;
relevant date (有關日期), in relation to a particular section 8 purpose, means the date specified under section 35(3) for that purpose;
section 8 purpose (第8條用途) means a purpose for which an e-system may be used under section 8;
transitional period (過渡期), in relation to a particular section 8 purpose, means the period beginning on the commencement date and ending on the relevant date.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Continued use of existing systems during transitional period

subsection.content: If, immediately before the commencement date, an existing system was used for a section 8 purpose, despite anything in this Ordinance, during the transitional period, the existing system may continue to be used for that purpose.
Anything that is done by means of an existing system during the transitional period pursuant to subsection (1) has the same effect as if it were done by means of an e-system.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a section 8 purpose, the Chief Justice may, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a date after which an existing system is not to be used for that purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under paragraph (a), specify different dates for different purposes.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may include details that relate to discontinuing the use of an existing system for the purpose concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not subsidiary legislation.
